description:
Using the FlatManager network driver, fixed IPs are deallocated, but never disassociated.

As a result, the cluster will eventually run out of fixed IPs and no new instances can be created, even if there have been no instances running for days.

This is because instance was untied from FixedIP in the nova/db/sqlalchemy/models.py, but the corresponding code in fixed_ip_disassociate was not updated.
title: fixed IPs are not disassociated with FlatManager

comments.content:
Using the FlatManager network driver, fixed IPs are deallocated, but never disassociated.

As a result, the cluster will eventually run out of fixed IPs and no new instances can be created, even if there have been no instances running for days.

This is because instance was untied from FixedIP in the nova/db/sqlalchemy/models.py, but the corresponding code in fixed_ip_disassociate was not updated.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~johannes.erdfelt

comments.content:
Fix proposed to branch: master
